column18: 03/01/2013: Assailants opened fire on the Planï¿½te FM radio station in the Koloma neighborhood of Conakry city, Conakry region, Guinea. No one was hurt in the attack; however, a bullet damaged a third-floor window of the building. The attack occurred around the same time that Faya Millimo, the leader of the opposition Liberal Bloc, was being interviewed at the station. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, authorities believed that the attack was related to political tensions over upcoming national elections.
column64: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources indicate that the incident is consistent with a larger pattern of violence between rival ethnic factions in the run-up to the Guinea legislative elections.
column108: The window of a building was damaged in this attack.

column18: 03/03/2013: Assailants attacked the offices of the Renaissance FM radio station in the Koloma neighborhood of Conakry city, Conakry region, Guinea. When the perpetrators failed to gain entry to the station, they hurled stones at windows. No one was hurt in the attack, which was the second such incident involving radio stations in Conakry in less than a week. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, but authorites believed the attack was perpetrated by individuals who were angry about the media's coverage of the upcoming national elections.
column38: Union of Free Radio and Television
